question: Which of the following is NOT one of the UI systems available in Unity?
options: UI Toolkit
Unity UI (uGUI)
IMGUI
Unreal UI

question: What is a key advantage of UI Toolkit compared to Unity UI (uGUI) and IMGUI?
options: It is the oldest and most stable UI system
It is based on standard web technologies for better cross-platform performance
It is exclusively designed for in-game debugging displays
It replaces the need for any GameObjects in UI development
correctAnswer: It is based on standard web technologies for better cross-platform performance

question: When should you use IMGUI in a Unity project?
options: For developing complex runtime UI for games
For creating custom Inspectors and in-game debugging displays
As the primary UI system for all new Unity projects
For creating mobile-friendly user interfaces
correctAnswer: For creating custom Inspectors and in-game debugging displays

question: Which statement best describes the current status of UI Toolkit in Unity?
options: It is the only UI system supported for new Unity projects
It is still missing some features found in Unity UI (uGUI) and IMGUI
It is exclusively used for developing UI within the Unity Editor
It has completely replaced the need for Unity UI (uGUI) and IMGUI
correctAnswer: It is still missing some features found in Unity UI (uGUI) and IMGUI

question: What is the main difference between UI Toolkit and Unity UI (uGUI)?
options: UI Toolkit is a retained-mode UI system, while Unity UI (uGUI) is GameObject-based
Unity UI (uGUI) is designed for web development, while UI Toolkit is for game UI
UI Toolkit relies on the OnGUI function, while Unity UI (uGUI) does not
Unity UI (uGUI) is newer and optimized for performance across platforms
correctAnswer: UI Toolkit is a retained-mode UI system, while Unity UI (uGUI) is GameObject-based
